risks.Risk Description: Cybersecurity is a ubiquitous concern—with 78% of respondents rating it as high or very high risk and almost 70% of audit functions reviewing it at least annually or continuously.

Risk Driver.Driver Description: Technology is identified as the common driver behind the top three risks, including cybersecurity.

risks.Trend: Cybersecurity risk remains consistently high; audit allocations have remained elevated since 2019.
Contextual Variations: Financial services respondents rate cybersecurity risk higher (89%) compared to publicly traded organizations (74%).

risks.Risk Description: IT risk refers to challenges and issues in the information technology areas not otherwise covered by specific risk categories.

Risk Driver.Driver Description: Technology is cited as a key driver influencing IT risk levels.

Contextual Variations: Publicly traded organizations tend to rate IT risk lower compared to financial services.

risks.Risk Description: Third-party relationships risk is noted as the third highest risk area, yet audit frequency for this area is significantly lower than its perceived risk.

Risk Driver.Driver Description: Increased reliance on third-party providers—for IT services, among other functions—drives this risk.

Contextual Variations: Privately held organizations rate this risk higher, while publicly traded organizations tend to rate it lower relative to other sectors.

risks.Risk Description: This risk involves challenges with meeting regulatory requirements excluding those related to internal controls over financial reporting.
Contextual Variations: Publicly traded organizations report lower compliance/regulatory risk levels compared to financial services.

risks.Risk Description: Operational risk pertains to potential losses resulting from inadequate or failed internal processes, systems, or human factors.
This risk relates to issues within enterprise risk management and the associated processes.
Fraud risk remains a key focus, with nearly 90% of respondents integrating fraud considerations into regular audits and many CAEs responsible for fraud investigations.
risks.Trend: Fraud risk remains consistently significant as a focus area in internal audits.

risks.Risk Description: Governance and culture risk involves potential weaknesses or deficiencies in an organization’s governance practices and cultural environment.
This risk pertains to vulnerabilities in financial reporting processes and internal controls, including those associated with Sarbanes-Oxley compliance.

Risk Driver.Driver Description: The implementation of Sarbanes-Oxley requirements necessitates rigorous controls, thereby influencing financial reporting risk levels.

risks.Trend: In publicly traded organizations, audit allocation for financial reporting has decreased for the first time in three years.
Contextual Variations: Publicly traded organizations emphasize this risk due to SOX requirements, whereas public sector and nonprofit organizations allocate less focus to it.

risks.Risk Description: This risk involves challenges associated with efforts to reduce costs and expenses, and is rated notably higher among nonprofit organizations.
risks.Trend: Audit allocations for cost/expense reduction have trended upward since 2019.
Contextual Variations: Nonprofit organizations rate cost/expense reduction risk significantly higher compared to other sectors.

risks.Risk Description: This risk relates to challenges in financial operations that fall outside the scope of internal controls over financial reporting.
This risk involves issues related to sustainability and non‐financial reporting, with moderate to high risk levels noted by respondents in certain sectors.
risks.Trend: Audit allocations for sustainability/non‐financial reporting have increased in publicly traded organizations since 2019.
Contextual Variations: Public sector organizations report higher perceived risk in sustainability/non‐financial reporting.

risks.Risk Description: This risk pertains to issues in effectively supporting external audit functions, with audit frequencies for this area being significantly higher than what the risk perception would suggest.
